feasts: Departure of St. Silvanus the Monk
1 Baramouda.summary: Marks the departure of St. Silvanus, a monk of St. Macarius known for visions and charity; the Arab raid on Scetis monasteries; and Aaron, Moses' brother, who performed miracles.

2 Baramouda.summary: Commemorates St. Christopher's martyrdom under Decius, converting soldiers; and Pope Yoannis IX's departure amidst Christian persecution.

feasts: Departure of St. John, Bishop of Jerusalem
3 Baramouda.summary: Honors St. John, a Jewish convert and Bishop of Jerusalem; and Pope Michael, a monk who served briefly as patriarch.

feasts: Martyrdom of Sts. Victor, Decius, Eirene, and Others
4 Baramouda.summary: Marks the martyrdom of Victor, Decius, Eirene, and others under Julian for destroying idol temples.

5 Baramouda.summary: Celebrates Ezekiel's prophecies, including Christ's birth; and St. Hepatius, a bishop martyred after the Council of Nicea.

feasts: Departure of St. Mary of Egypt
6 Baramouda.summary: Commemorates Christ's appearance to Thomas post-resurrection; and St. Mary of Egypt, a repentant hermit who lived 47 years in the desert.

feasts: Departure of Sts. Agapius, Theodora, Metruf
7 Baramouda.summary: Honors Joachim, Mary's father; St. Macrobius, a monk who built monasteries; and martyrs Agapius, Theodora, and Metruf.

feasts: Martyrdom of Virgins Agape, Eirene, Shiona
8 Baramouda.summary: Marks the martyrdom of virgins Agape, Eirene, and Shiona in Thessalonica; and 150 believers killed by the Persian king.

9 Baramouda.summary: Commemorates St. Zosimus, who met St. Mary of Egypt; and Pope Shenouda I's miracle, repelling Arabs from Scetis.

10 Baramouda.summary: Honors Anba Isaac, a monk under Anba Apollo; and Pope Gabriel II, a scholar who set church canons.

feasts: Departure of St. John, Bishop of Gaza
11 Baramouda.summary: Marks St. Theodora, a nun with divine visions; and St. John, Bishop of Gaza.

feasts: Departure of St. Alexander, Bishop of Jerusalem
Commemoration of St. Antonios, Bishop of Tamoui
12 Baramouda.summary: Commemorates St. Alexander, tortured under Decius; and St. Antonios, Bishop of Tamoui.

feasts: Martyrdom of Sts. Joshua and Joseph
13 Baramouda.summary: Honors monks Joshua and Joseph, martyred; deaconess Dionisa and martyr Medius; and Pope Yoannis XVII, who built churches.

14 Baramouda.summary: Marks Pope Maximus, who fought heresy and served 17 years as patriarch.

15 Baramouda.summary: Celebrates the altar for St. Nicholas; St. Agabus' church; Empress Alexandra's martyrdom; and Pope Mark VI's departure.

16 Baramouda.summary: Commemorates St. Antipas, bishop of Pergamos, martyred in a brass bull under Domitian.

feasts: Martyrdom of St. James the Apostle
17 Baramouda.summary: Marks the martyrdom of St. James, beheaded by Herod for preaching the Gospel.

18 Baramouda.summary: Commemorates St. Arsenius, slave of St. Sousnyous, beheaded for his faith.

feasts: Martyrdom of St. Simeon and 150 Others
Martyrdom of Vizier Fahd and Companions
19 Baramouda.summary: Honors St. Simeon and 150 martyrs; Youhanna Abu Nagaah, tortured for faith; Vizier Fahd, unburned in fire; and monk Daoud.

20 Baramouda.summary: Marks St. Babnuda, a hermit monk drowned with a stone for confessing Christ.

21 Baramouda.summary: Celebrates Virgin Mary and St. Hierotheos, a priest who converted many in Athens.

feasts: Departure of St. Isaac of Hourin
22 Baramouda.summary: Honors St. Isaac, an ascetic; Pope Alexander I, who fought Arius; and Popes Mark II and Michael II.

23 Baramouda.summary: Commemorates St. George, tortured and beheaded for tearing Diocletian’s edict.

24 Baramouda.summary: Marks Pope Shenouda I, who repelled Arabs and fought heresy; and St. Sina, beheaded for faith.

feasts: Martyrdom of St. Sarah and Her Sons
Commemoration of Sts. Babnuda, Theodore, and 100 Martyrs
25 Baramouda.summary: Honors St. Sarah and her sons, burned for faith; and Sts. Babnuda, Theodore, and 100 martyrs.

26 Baramouda.summary: Commemorates St. Sousenyos, beheaded for baptizing; and Pope Youannis VII, who faced persecution.

27 Baramouda.summary: Marks St. Boctor, a minister’s son, beheaded with a girl who saw his crown.

28 Baramouda.summary: Commemorates St. Milius, an ascetic shot with arrows for preaching Christ.

29 Baramouda.summary: Honors St. Erastus, a bishop who worked with Paul; and St. Acacius, a persecuted bishop.

feasts: Martyrdom of St. Mark the Evangelist
30 Baramouda.summary: Marks St. Mark, dragged and martyred in Alexandria for preaching Christ.
